item.title: An LLM plays OpenTTD
item.description:
After being inspired by the post that shows Claude Code playing RCT2, I’d imagine something like that, but for Open Transport Tycoon Deluxe (OpenTTD). OpenTTD readily available and there’s been some ways of making AI / Bots but they’re pretty much carved in stone once you implement them. There is no way to have them dynamically change their code or ways of work while running. (afaik!)

And my goals was to have an LLM try instead. It would be pretty cool to have a LLM drive a company within OpenTTD. So the first thing I came up with is a LLM generating its own code files that will could reloaded every time through the CLI:

item.description:

item.title: Huub
item.description: Working with the team from Huub I’ve setup the authentication & authorization stack with Auth0. I’ve also worked on improving endpoints and websocket handling. As well as setting up architecture for multi-tenancy within Auth0 and the FastAPI stack.

item.title: Tellart
item.description:
I’ve worked with Tellart on the Dinner in 2050 installation for the UAE Pavilion. For COP28 the goal of this installation is to make people think about climate change in a very personal way.

Visitors would be asked to tell about their favorite dish which would then be transformed into a dish in 2050 with an ingredient swapped out that would have the most impact on climate change. Over 18.000 meals were generated by the visitors.
